column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We stopped by this location as it was in the area close by the Doughnut Vault to pick up a small 9" pizza for two
column2: which consisted of 4 slices of pizza.  It took 30 minutes to make from the moment you place the order
column3: so we were lucky to have one person in the car (street parking is $2 per 30 minutes or so) and the other person waiting for the food.We chose to sample their Chicago's Classic Small Pan deep dish with butter crust for ~$16 and thought the toppings were just A-OK.  The crust definitely won us over
column4: but the presentation and toppings did not blow us out of the water. We picked to have lunch at the Millennium Park close by
column5: so maybe if we dined in next time our opinion will change.
